review: Usually I hate places like Chili's. Its a very boring, generic, chain with mediocre food, prices, and service. However I had a fantastic experience at this location on a Monday afternoon. It happened to be college football all day so it was happy hour in the bar all day. They have some great deals. I totally recommend going to Chili's for Happy Hour. Get full and buzzed on very little money! My kinda restaurant. I got a top shelf margarita (or two) and they were both great. I got some vegetarian tacos and they were great, and the chips, salsa, and guacamole were good too.

I ate at this place this evening and it is by far in the top 10 worst chain businesses in the industry,for a 10 dollar hamburger place I expect damn near perfection,the waitress brought my wife the wrong burger then by the time she got what she wanted i was finished with my dinner,it had so much sauce(ketchup and tobasco tasting)that i couldnt tell there was ground beef in it.the cooking station was so noisy it sounded like a chinese laundry chasing a chicken around the kitchen drowning out the piped music.amazingly even though my wife and i had different burgers they both tasted the same and mine had blue cheese on it.....Damn I should have read the reviews first!!!!!!!!save your money,crappy food and even worse service
I love their chips, salsa and queso.  I think that's the best thing on the menu.
Best Sunday deal in town.  All day happy hour, free nachos and salsa and discounted foods all day Sundays.

We went on a Saturday evening and sat in the bar, as there was a 10-minute wait for a table for two. The corner seat was immediately under an air vent that blew so hard it rippled the plant leaves behind me; we were both cold the entire time. Our appetizer arrived very quickly. Our server was attentive in terms of drink refills. But those were the only good things about our experience. Our dinner took a long time to arrive. When we were finished, she asked if I wanted a box. I said "yes, please." She took my plate, and I was under the impression she was containerizing my food for me. She came back with boxes for adjacent tables, and my food was history. I don't have high expectations for a Chili's, but this time I still felt let down, which was hard to do. And my head is still cold from that darn air vent!

Yes it's a food chain dammit, but I love me some Chilis. Their happy hour is awesome (Margaritas all around!),  The hubby loves their ribs (with that Shiner Bock BBQ sauce) with the loaded mashed potatoes and those yummy cinnamon apples. The paradise pie is a really good dessert item. I love their queso dip. I could eat that and their grilled corn on the cob and be good to go. Two words: Southwest egg rolls. They are scrumptious.

We come to Chilis maybe 2 times a month. The food is an expected average quality, but better than fast food. Service is usually pretty good to the occasional excellent.   The coupons they send us work pretty well as I'm off work the same days the coupons are valid for. The latest which the wifey and I have taken advantage of is the 'free app or dessert'. It works great, we order the required entree and get a free nachos... We've used it this way several times with no troubles, except the last time. The manager explained that we needed to order 2 entrees for 2 people, whereas the coupon clearly states 'one adult entree purchase required'.  Just didn't appreciate the attitude she gave us. Then, on top of everything, the top of the receipt where there is usually the survey to fill out was totally torn off!   Sad when someone knows you're gonna blast them so they try to take away your opportunity. Still good servers and good atmosphere.
Pleasant restuarant and Sports Pub to meet friends.  Extended Happy hours !!!!! Food is good to excellent and price is reasonable. My experience with service has been agreeable. Casual attire..

3pm on Saturday... Servers are too busy to stop and take our orders.   At least we had ordered appetizers when they took our initial drink order our else we'd be famished and dying... Too bad.  The appetizer was good though. Still waiting on our order... Food came... Fajitas were just barely cooked, came to table semi-warm...  Still waiting to see if hubby gets ill... Funny thing is fajitas delivered to another table were sizzling away...

Great 2 for $20 deal! I came here one late evening just in time for happy hour. My hubby and I ordered their 2 for $20 deal in which we selected baby back ribs, chicken pasta, along with chips & guacamole dip. The deal is totally worth it. My hubby was a bit iffy about the ribs but they came out to be truly amazing for the price we paid for. I would recommend going with the original house sauce for the ribs. My chicken pasta was very good. They provided ample amount of chicken on top that was juicy and not too dry; just how I like it. I was under the assumption that the meals were going to be served in smaller portions considering you're paying a lot less! But nope, they were full entree meals. I had to take a box and to-go half of my pasta home! The guacamole dip was mediocre; something that can be easily made from home. They were generous to refill our chips not once, but twice!  The service here is great. Our waitress was very attentive and took good care of us. I will definitely be back for dinner another night!

We had not been to Chili's in quite awhile, had dinner this weekend and were overall pleased.  My husband and I tried something different and both liked our food.  My husband ordered the BLT quesadilla and I had the Southwest Chicken wrap along with a cup of their Chicken Enchilada soup.  Both meals were yummy!  The only draw back is our server wasn't the most attentive.  Never the less we will go back again and again.

My husband and I wrote a complaint and received a call back from someone at the company. They were very polite and we were surprised in the mail with $40 gift coupons for the restaurant, so we went back for lunch and brought the kids. The food was still good, but we did have a service problem. Nice waitress and it didn't look busy but we waited almost 30 minutes for our meal to hit the table, and another 10 to receive our condiments/refills etc.,  about 10 minutes to get our boxes, and another 10 minutes for our check to be paid. That is not included in the time it took for the manager to come out and greet our table and ask us if our visit was better than our previous visit. Because of the special gift checks we had,  he knew we had experienced a problem. He was very nervous and fidgety and looked pretty uncomfortable but he was still very nice. I appreciate them for trying, I just think they really need to focus on quality of service, between managers, and staff. Fix that and they will do amazing!

The two for twenty keeps Chili's in competition with Fridays and Applebees in fact you can hardly distinguish any of those three establishments from each other. Decent burgers, mexican food and cheap steaks.

I'd like to start out by saying, I LOVE Chili's. Just not this location. It's the closest one to me, but I dont mind driving the extra 7 minutes to roseville to get good customer service. I've come here a few different times & been disappointed with the attentiveness of the servers & the incredibly long time it's take to get my food even when the restaurant is relatively empty, but this most recent time was definitely the straw that broke the camels back.   It was last saturday evening, about 9pm. The restaurant was probably 1/3 full, but it took the host about 10 minutes to notice us & seat us, so that was the beginning of me becoming annoyed. Me & my boyfriend decided what we wanted before the waitress even came to get our drink order (another 10 minutes) , so we ordered it all at once & asked for chips & salsa while we waited. At that point I was really frustrated because I'd been in the restaurant for 20 minutes already & nothing to show for it. I waited another 10 minutes before my boyfriend asked me if I just wanted to leave, because we still hadn't gotten our drinks or anything, so I said "sure, let's get out of here." So we got up & left & the host asked very confused why we were leaving & I very simply let her know that we'd been there a half hour & didn't even have drinks yet. While we were walking to the car I saw the waitress put our drinks at the table, but no chips & salsa. We drove to Red Robin instead & they gave us our drinks immediately & a basket of fries while we waited. Go there instead.

My daughter enjoys the chips and queso... she had the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich, I ordered the Chile Lime Tilapia.  The chips are good.. she enjoyed her sandwich.  The Tilapia set my mouth on FIRE.  I like spice, and can handle it hot.. but this was outrageous.  I would have sent it back, but once we were served the waitress didn't return.  We had to ask another waiter for our check to get her back to the table.  The prices are inexpensive, but we won't go back until my daughter wants the chips and queso again.  I'll play it safe and do the house salad.

My previous rate was 2 stars and that was being generous. I decided I would give them another chance and came here with friends for lunch. After this trip, I thought I should officially give them one star. It was busy for a Sunday afternoon, but I have definitely seen it much crazier. While we were seated immediately, that is about the only fast service we got. I have never had to wait so long for a few soups and salads. Two of us ordered a cup of chicken enchilada soup, which used to be my favorite, and they were on the watery side. Another friend of mine ordered some kind of spicy tacos, but said there wasn't a pinch of spice in them. All in all, the service was slow, the food was once again mediocre, and the experience disappointing. My last experience was much worse, but between the two visits I would give this location 1 star.

Went for lunch on Friday afternoon at 1:00 pm.  The back area by the windows had the AC up so high that we asked to move.  The new table was much warmer.   Up sides: the food was cooked well.  The server brought all appropriate condiments. Down sides: there weren't enough servers or the server had too many tables- I don't think the server himself was bad; however, everything took forever- getting soup/chips, drink refills, the check, etc. I eat here all the time, and it was as good as it usually is.

I normally don't like Chilis but I was meeting someone there for lunch. They had a bunch of new menu items so I decided to try the tilapia. I was actually surprised on how good it was. Everything on the plate was nice and fresh and the best part about it was it was low in calories!

Bad. Just so bad. I went out to lunch today with my mother, and sister and was BEYOND disappointed in the service. I work in the restaurant industry and I realize that there is a lunch rush, and things can be hectic. However, we did not come during lunch rush hours, and there weren't many tables. We were told two servers would be helping us out, so you'd think that the service would be even better than usual right? Wrong. Our server Janelle started out by taking our drink order, which when she brought out was wrong. We ordered an appetizer, and it came out in a decent amount of time. Never came back to ask us how our food was, appetizer or entree. We sat with our glasses empty for at least 10 minutes before she even noticed us. Right after she brought our food out, she brought the check... We didn't even get a chance to take a bite out of our food! It wasn't busy so why the need to rush us?  I'm not complaining about the food by any means. But if you get assigned her as a server, I highly suggest patience being one of your personality traits. She will ignore you, until she absolutely has to talk to you. Even then, it's the bare minimum. Not even a half assed smile! I know sometimes your job can suck, but that doesn't mean you have to make our experience terrible.

Poor service.  Waiter argued about our coupon validity and had to have us explain it to him. It was a leisurely lunch so we were there for awhile, we were never given drink refills or offered dessert. Food was okay. Not my first time being disappointed at this location but it will probably be my last.

5 stars? Yes! Maybe because I did lunch and I guess I'm very lucky because my lunch experiences are usually pretty darn fantastic almost anywhere (maybe extreme hunger has something to do with it). The last time I was there, the place was pretty empty and I like that because things get done better and with a little more care. I started off with nachos and corn/guacamole which was a great start. Then I ordered the "make it a combo" where I could choose 2 things out of quite the selection.  I decided on shrimp and baby back ribs in BBQ sauce, mashed potatoes and broccoli for about $17.50.  I also ordered a little side of rice. My expectations weren't very high but I took a chance because it sounded good and figured that for $17.50  they would at least try to be a little impressive.  Well let me tell you, the shrimp was really good and the ribs pretty much fell off the bone and  were absolutely delicious! Janel was our server and she was Fabulous. Yet another great place for lunch.

Stopped for a quick dinner with friends on the way to see Jesuit play none of is had been there for quite a while.  Liked the new decor and new menu. Service was great, new menu had lots of great choices - we all enjoyed our food.  And we were on our way to the play with no rising needed. Great evening!

We weren't some of the crazy people who were out super early for Black Friday shopping, but we came out during the late morning after it died down a lil bit.  So after hitting up the Sunrise Mall we were STARVING.  So we stopped into the local Chili's because my wife LOVES the enchilada soup and since it was Friday we could order off the lunch menu.  She got the toasted turkey sandwich with a bowl of the enchilada soup($6) and I got unlimited side salads with unlimited soup($7).  Right off the bat service was slow.  They said their computers were down and warned us ahead of time that they were slow.  Ok, no problem.  Also when you order the unlimited soup/salad you also get chips and salsa.  Probably to fill you up, but still thought it was cool.  I enjoyed watching the college football games on the many tv's and the food was good.  Wife was frustrated because her soup had one chunk of chicken in it and mine had six, but I am a nice guy and gave her a few of mine.  I like the express lunch menu because it has good choices and good value.  Will for sure try it out again.

Have been here probably 4 or 5 times in the last two months for dinner and have been very pleased. Each time we have ordered off the 2 for $20 menu (two entrees and an appetizer) great deal and the food is a great value. Always start with the chips and guacamole (salsa included as well) the chips - great. salsa-great. guac-great. refills are included as well. All but once I have ordered the Margarita grilled chicken (two small chicken breasts, topped with pico on top of a full plate of rice and black beans. It is excellent!  Service could be better but is by no means bad. Servers typically have a higher number of tables as is common for casual low ticket restaurants, so it may take them a minute but they always provide drinks and table service in a timely manner. Overall, great option if you want good food at an affordable price.

HORRIBLE PLACE! Chili's on Sunrise used to be good, not anymore.  Went there tonight.  Had a burger, was obviously precooked, and the bun wasn't fresh.  If that wasn't bad enough, I found 2 bones and a piece of gristle in my burger.  This has never happened before, and I have eaten hundreds of their burgers.  I spoke to the manager, who never even apologized.  All he said was that they have the same meat supplier, didn't even offer to take a buck off the burger.  Chili's this is your lose of great customers.    We WON'T be back!

This by far is the worst chilis I've been to and I've even worked at a couple in my day. The staff is not very friendly, the service is usually mediocre at best and management is never to be seen. Upon our lady visit my g/f and i decided to order take out on line to avoid the staff...bad idea! After standing at the take out counter for 5 min without any one acknowledging we were there, we were finally helped and told they must have lost or order. Seriously!? Order again...30 min later someone lets us know our oder is on it's way. Finally! Get home and what do you know...food is old and cold. Upon informing them, still no sight of a manager. What do we get for the trouble...$5 coupon. No thanks!!!
Gathered a group of 20, called a few hours ahead, and were greeted with great service, great food, and good prices. Well done guys.

My margarita grilled chicken was very tasty and the service was better than other Chili's restaurants.    This place has a tablet on every table.  You can play games and pay your tab by credit card on it.   There are other stuff you can do but I didn't bother.
Love the Grilled Chicken Salad! Castro is an awesome waiter! We eat here every week! Service is awesome! Drinks never go empty

Our waiter is not so good.... Asked what we wanted to drink and soon as my husband said he wanted water .... He took off, I had to order my soda after he returned.   He would not look at us as we ordered, was rushed and not paying attention.  Never gave us an opportunity to order an appetizer which I have craving their big soft pretzels.....  Just brought my dinner and my potatoes have skins after I asked twice if they were in there!!!!!!  "Oh no we no longer have them in our mashed potato's!"    So not acceptable!!!!

A group of 5 of us came here for lunch and I was happy to find this location is better than the Roseville one.  I was first surprised how packed they were at lunchtime with all the kids and families. Does anybody work?! But then I realized it was spring break. Luckily we were still able to get a table with no wait and were quickly greeted by an energetic server. One thing I HATE (that Chevy's does too) is have those stupid iPad like screens at our table. They pass them off as "helpful" by explaining how we can order drinks from them, pay our bill and play games. Wait, didn't we go out to eat to actually spend time together? I thought so... Last thing we need is another electronic device to stare at. Please take these ridiculous things away, we will stick to the old fashioned interacting with a human server for our meal thank you. We ordered the chips and salsa as an appetizer which were good. Even with 5 of us we didn't finish the whole basket. Then our entrees came out in a reasonable amount of time.  I ordered the Vegetarian Black Bean Burger with lettuce, avocado, cheese, onion strings and some tasty sauce. I thought the burger was good, but had more rice/grain in the party than black beans. The last time I had their black bean burger was probably at least 10 years ago and it's definitely changed since then! I miss the old smashed black bean patty. The fries that came with the burger were only ok, they seemed to have been sitting under a heat lamp for too long and weren't fresh or crispy. Everyone else ordered salads which they all enjoyed. No one in our party was able to finish their meal! Not even close, we each ended up taking half home. Chili's has a very small lunch menu so we all ended up ordering regular sized dinner portions. Needless to say we were all stuffed! I would come back here if my Boss picked it again for lunch. Otherwise I would probably choose one of the many restaurants in the vicinity which have fresher, healthier meals not loaded with fat and sodium.

Went yesterday for lunch with hubby, we were first ones there, waited a few and finally a guy come out with menues and sat us down without saying a word. Atleast ten minutes passed before the waitress came by and took drink order, we were ready to order appetizer but she said she wasnt ready and had to get apron? After we saw three other tables who came in after  us get their food we were about to ask but another lady brought it.Soup was luke warm and its sad when the best thing is the frozen fries.Anyway wed been there almost an hour and needed to get going os asked for the bill and was told we could pay at table with their new device.Waitress said she would show us but it was pretty easy except for the reciept part.It came out completely blank.Had to call waitress over and she asked if needed reciept and i said YES please. She dissapeared for another 5 minutes then was spotted taking an order.Got her attention and finally the reciept.We wont be going back as theres way too many good places with better service in our area.The Habit up the street is great for burgers and cheaper too and they have more taste!

Took the wife and 2 sons there for Mother's Day today. Our youngest is 7 and he and his big brother were entertained by the on table "iPad" video games. Food was good, Margueritas very good and the waitress Krista was excellent. She made the day!!!!

I'm a regular here. Try to get Phalesia or Sara as a server. I've found most all of the servers to be pleasant here, but those two are more efficient. The managers that I've met are great (Carlos and Chris), and any problems I've had were addressed satisfactorily if I brought it up. Highly recommend the mango-chile chicken, flatbreads, and spicy grilled shrimp tacos!

Came here to meet up with some friends. The service was much better than expected.Victor was our server and Victor is a million times better and more attentive then most servers I've experienced. Ten star service. Funds are tight but if I could have left more than a 30% tip, I would have. Thanks so much for the great service!!!

I don't know what has happened to Chili's, don't know if it is this Chili's or all Chili's. Have been to this restaurant many times over the last 15 years and always had the mind set of "nothing fantastic, but good and decent food and always consistent".  It was kind of late for us (08:30 or so) a week ago and had the kids home for a visit and it was too hot to cook...so we decided on Chili's. I like a friendly waiter as much as anyone, but our waiter was WAY over the top...stood at the table and chatted for 10 minutes like we were his new best friends..talking about video games and movies...um, can I have my iced tea please!! We actually got to the point of not talking, just waving that the food was okay (which it wasn't) There were four of us and since it was late we decided to just share the appetizer sampler plate and fajitas and chips/salsa. The chips and salsa were very, very greasy, as if the chips were soaked in cold grease too long.  Not crunchy and light as they used to be.  They were shiny with grease and soft...okay, pass on those.  Nothing on the appetizer plate was hot and none of it seemed freshly prepared.  The fajitas came (don't remember the price but close to $20 for a combo of steak, chicken and shrimp) and there was about 6 cubes of steak about an inch square that were too tough to bite through and maybe 8 small shrimp and half a dozen small strips of chicken (maybe half a breast worth).  The "condiment" plate had a few shot glass size metal cups with a tablespoon each of shredded cheese, pico de gallo, salsa, etc. about enough for ONE fajita. Too bad, our "decent and consistent" go to dinner spot has gone to the birds, time to find a new spot.  We won't be back.

Always treated well by the staff. We sit in the bar because the food comes out faster and they have big screen TV's. Usually I get chips and salsa, salad and hot wings, which are crispy and delicious!  Don't understand the poor reviews here but maybe that's because they sit in the restaurant area.

I, for the most part, think Chili's is an ok chain. This one always has issues. No matter what day we go, I always have the same question...... How hard is it to serve freaking HOT mashed potatoes? I have sent them back a couple of times, other times dealt with it. After other discrepancies (over salted corn on the cob, my friend paying $7 for a nacho appetizer that literally had 10 big chips in a design decorating the plate....hardly worth $7, and lackluster food), my friends who always convince me to go to this location decided that we have all had enough. I think Chili's is a place by place experience, but avoid this one. Been here about six times over the past 5 years or so, and we always leave like we feel we were cheated out of our money

Pathetic.  Our table was given away.  Got seated after I stormed the hostess desk.  No "Oh dear, we are so sorry ."   Still waiting for food.    With all of the competition in Citrus Heights, you'd think they would be sharper on service.
I've always had good service and food here. Since they've remodeled....there are way more TVs for us sports fan. My favorite is the Cajun pasta.
Food is ok, but no happy hour??? They so need a happy hour we go to Elephant Bar even the waitress in the bar told us we should try Elephant bar.... Lol

Came here last minute for dinner. I was so excited to eat and have a drink after a long day. Unfortunately, Chili's has downgraded on their ingredients and the freshness of their food which i was unaware of. The service was good but that was probably the only good part about the ENTIRE dinner. The drink which was $7 had a droplet of alcohol and 2 gallons of sugar( being sarcastic) but in reality thats what it tasted like. The food was not even a bit good and you could tell that they did not change the oil when they made the batch of fries my fiancé ended up with. Overall, we had wasted a good $40 that could have gone to a better place.
Had chicken enchiladas and the rice and black beans. Beans and rice excellent...The cheese enchiladas were better then the ones I had today but still good. The service was OK.

Food was good as always. Server was good but in now way personable. Biggest complaint is that my husband is Active Duty Army and whether they offer a military discount depends on which manager was on duty..... so basically the managers personal views determine whether or not chilis shows appreciation to our service members. And there were other people in uniform eating while we were here.
Great service, long menu.  We LOVE their pretzel stick appetizer and I love their Cajun pasta!  Highly recommend for a quick, yummy meal!

I can't tell you how much these guys took me from their competitors. Good food, great, amazing, spectacular service, great location, family friendly, group friendly, and a fantastic place to eat when you don't feel like cooking. I recommend whomever manages this place, take your methods to other chains, and build! Thank you for my meal! I so recommend you come here.

I've been to a lot a Chilis restaurants through  the country, this one is average. On a recent visit we came between lunch and dinner, the place was nearly empty, and we were left to wait a long time to be seated. Then our waitress didn't come to take our order for 30 minutes. After we ordered it took forever for the food to come. When it finally came it was cold. Not a good experience. Hopefully they will step it up the next time we pop in. If not we won't be back.

I wanna give like 3 1/2 stars. Waiter was nice, gave me a sweet compliment. After a while though, we didn't really see much of him.  Food was eh (to me). The fried pickles were awesome though! I had the big mouth bites (sliders)  portions were small i thought when seeing everyone's plate. My friend had a ton of fries while i had about 10 fries on my plate. Not a huge deal since i dont eat many, but they need to do better on plating/sizing.  The food in general makes me think of old people food. Not good. Lol
Great found really good prices only spent about 14 including tip on lunch for myself and a coworker
My daughter treated me to lunch and although it was awhile ago, I remember the waitstaff were very nice and the food was so good! I not only eat my meal, but I ate the rest of hers!

I didn't have a great experience the last time I went to a Chili's, but today was different. The food was good (I had a Fresh Mex bowl) and they are using these iPad-like things to supposedly speed up the ordering/payment process. I still wanted to talk to an actual person when placing my order and used the device to pay instead. They also told me there were games available to play while you wait (I'm assuming its mostly for bored children) but they cost $0.99 each on the device. They seemed to offer their side of pickles with everything and they were ok, but still a bit more like a cucumber than a pickle.

This is my neighborhood restaurant.   I come here whenever possible.  The food is always delicious and the staff is friendly and always have a smile.  I usually eat at the bar so I've been served by Troy, Nicole, & Vanessa.  Love them!

This place has had bad service in the past but the food is always good. Today's visit was different in that we experienced both good service AND good food. I tried the smokehouse burger cooked medium well and the meat alone was VERY tasty so it made for a wonderful overall meal.
Food tastes goods,  but the prices are too high for what you get. I come for the lava cake for my kids,  but I think I'm going to stop coming for the other food.

We used to love this place and go there all the time but service is so bad we're not going back. My daughter and I were seated quickly and we were brought water. The place wasn't that busy but nobody helped us. I tried to flag down a waitress but we were ignored. After 20 minutes we left. Nobody seemed to notice. Employees were having a swell time visiting with each other and chatting. We went back another time, giving them a second chance. We were told there was a 5 minute wait. The hostess was seating people in the bar but since one of us was under 21 we had to wait for a table. After a nervous hostess told us it would be just a second (about 5 times) we were starting to doubt it. It didn't look to busy. A lot of tables were open. After 30 minutes we left and went to Mr. Pickles across the parking lot. I figure by the time we got home with our sandwiches we might be getting water and maybe a menu at Chili's.

Love this chilis location. We always have the nicest service and quality of food here. I can say the zoosk pay system makes it so easy when we want to go or order some extra pineapple blueberry margaritas!

One of the most unsatisfactory places I've seen in a long time there operating as if there going under and there using the customer to stay afloat the poor quality of service I'd horrendous, waitresses acting like children ignoring the customers as they arrive laughing and giggling with each other and pulling our check out of the sleeve to show us how much she should be tipped was a new low !!!! Also the watered down soft drinks runny watery ranch dressing is a straight slap across the face ! When you go to a restraint like this you except more !!!!  You guys should be ashamed !!?!

I use to really enjoy going to chilis.  However, my last experience was not so great.   I ended up with food poisoning, I even recall the person sitting in front of us sending their food back because it was undercooked.  For spending about 60 dollars on the dinner and then getting sick was pretty disappointing.  I have not been back since.
gritsle on my burger! small portions but higher prices , pretty cut and clear at this place

Crowded and not enough servers. Took 35 minutes after the main meal came out for someones side salad to arrive with no apology for the obvious delay. My drink never got refilled the whole time even though it was obvious the glass was empty. No water refills... No hows your dinner inquiries... The chips ran out and the salsa was as close to red water as you can get. Not a happy experience.
Pretty average service. They forgot our soup and ended up bringing it after the entrees arrived. They were very apologetic and did comp the soup. Food was tasty and hot.

worst dining experience of my entire life. when we first got to the bar on friday night, 3/13/15  at around 9 or 10 pm in fact, the bar tender was to busy talking to the only other person at the bar practically and had us waiting to put in our order although we were clearly waiting on him and he was like a foot away. so we decide to move to one of the tables at the bar instead, maybe the waitress wouldn't be as bad, but in fact she was worst and we had to wait agin for about 10 min because she was talking to someone. we could tell they were mad about us leaving the bar without closing out, even heard them and saw them gesturing over and talking about us, when we finally got our food she never gave me a plate for my fajitas, n couldn't ask because she was never around, and when we finished we both got sick. we both think they did something to the food. we got a to go order for someone else and she got sick as well. all i know is i will never be returning. i knew we should of went to elephant bar. won't make that mistake again

My wife and I have been coming here for years. Granite, this review is only for happy hour. Our service in the bar was second to non. Our server has been at our location for year, and we are never disappointed. Fast and friendly every time. And good prices's and food.

I was here a couple weeks ago on a Thursday and my service was okay, the waitress could of been more attentive and didn't ask once of i wanted more chips and salsa also didn't tell me my different options when I ordered the stuffed nachos. I didn't realize that the nachos could be with chicken or with beef. But what really made me upset was that when I asked the waitress if I can get some chips and salsa to go,  she told me that her manager said no. Never have I been told no about taking chips and salsa home from chilis. And I eat at chilis at least once or twice a month. I more than likely will not be choosing this location any time soon. The fairway location near blue oaks theatre does an amazing job no matter how busy or slow they are.

Actually Zero stars! Wedding rehearsal went from great to a train wreck once we came through the door. Slow service, incorrect orders over and over, cold food when it did come out and a very flippant attitude by the manager to top it off. Oh and don't look into the kitchen. I did and there are just some things you can't unsee. cred to our waitress who at least had a pulse and tried to cover for the incompetence of everyone else around her.

This place is great and always has great food when I go. I try to get the same thing I never branch out! So try the chipotle chicken crispers and get extra ranch on the side, this place only got four stars only because it is very dark in there during the p.m. hours of dining

We left here this afternoon to NEVER return to another Chilis establishment.  Service was fine if you're ok with the "I'm so hip that I say "right on"and "rad" after every visit to the table.  Food was far south of terrible.  Let's start with the basic broccoli side for my daughters lunch: nuked to the fullest, rubber texture and inedible.  I had the "chicken" avocado sandwich (which was removed from our bill bc I actually had to say something about how gross it was.. I never complain). It had the consistency of a chicken nugget. You know, pressed Bologna?) I explained to the gracious manager that it was like a frozen fast food meat.  He explained that I was correct, the chicken is frozen and cautiously thawed. Just gross :(.   My husband had the steak fajitas which he described as beef jerky tacos covered in some strange red sauce that he couldn't quite figure out.   Left hungry and feeling as if we just flushed $40 down the toilet.  Bye bye corporate food! Yuck yuck yuck :(

Went to this Chili's for dinner yesterday as a party of 10 and we had a great server. I think his name was Justin?  He was really good with the kids and was on queue every time we needed something. The wait wasn't too bad about 20 minutes on a Friday night, but the did call us right as happy hour ended and we didn't know until they called us. I would go back to this Chili's again.

I straight up love this place. The chicken crisper so are my favorite. My group got burgers, fish tacos, and a Mexican platter. Nothing but compliments. The food is amazing and the service is pretty good.

*singing*  I want my baby back, baby back, baby back...  Out of all the big American style neighborhood restaurants (Applebees, TGIF, Sizzler, Ruby Tuesday, etc.), well most that I have been to anyway, Chili's is probably the one I can tolerate most.  Although that could be changing soon.  Here's why...      Chili's is in the process of evolving their order placement system from a personal human service (wait staff) to an automated table kiosk where you can place your own order without much need of human intervention.  Applebee's is playing with this system as well, but their food sucks (DO'OH!) so we won't go that deep.  Moving along...  The reason that I have a problem with this is that these kiosks are job-killers.  These systems may not have an immediate, profound, impact toward jobs in their company, but ultimately they will.  The system is designed for efficiency and the ability to terminate existing positions which will in-turn improve the corporate Bottom Line.  But who am I to stand boldly on this train track, with my arms in the air, as the Technology train comes barreling my way, hauling a hell of a lot of inevitable "change" behind it?  I am one man.  One man who can change little, but avoid this train track altogether.  It's frustrating to see this kind of change, and yet most will see it as convenience.  Which, in fact, is.      Now that I have carried on much longer than I should have.  This Chili's was clean inside, and the staff was helpful and friendly.  Our waitress even smiled as she introduced us to the self-ordering system at the table as she provided instructions on how to use it (okay I am over it.  I promise!  Ha!).  I usually have ribs when I come to Chili's because frankly, I am impressed with how well they turn out.  On this date, however, I opted to do their latest promo which was Top Shelf Tacos.  You can mix and match which types of tacos you get, so that was cool.  I ordered a couple of spicy shrimp and one tilapia.  They were alright, nothing amazing but definitely "hit the spot!"  If you're expecting spicy from the spicy shrimp tacos, you're going get mild; just a heads up.  The rice and beans that flanked them were pretty ordinary.  I will stick to ribs next time.  My brothers and my father enjoyed their meals very much, and overall we had a great experience together.      Three stars, our waitress deserves five.  She was efficient and had a great sense of humor.  There is plenty of private parking because this chili's is located in a shopping complex.  I will probably be back again because it is a good option when you are hungry but don't know exactly what you want.  Until customers are forced to use the Chili's help-yourself system anyway...  Ha!   (deep voice) Barbeque Sauce...  *ends singing*

Came here for happy hour. Service was slow and restaurant was dead. I Ordered: the skillet queso , chips and salsa to start  The skillet queso came out warm and had bland taste , very sad because this place usually has really good skillet queso  though. That was a letdown.  I would recommend:  the grilled chicken broccoli and potatoes with white gravy as a main dish  The chicken is always tender and juicy was  good flavor While sitting at the bar there was a foul fish smelling odor which was displeasing the entire time I was here not sure why they need to clean better here it seems like.  Overall a decent experience a let down to my normal visits at this location

We came in an hour before close to take advantage of happy hour and get a quick bite and drink. The customer service was great and we did not feel rushed at all. Food was delicious and drinks were good. My husband and I tried the fried pickles and will not be getting those again. It was more "pickle" than "fried" which threw me off since the picture made it look close to what you get with friend zucchini or onion rings, but that's okay, we still finished them all :) My mom got the spiced onion rings which were great! We took home leftovers and closed the place down, never feeling like an inconvenience. I would definitely recommend this Chili's to anyone!
Great Customer Service!!!!! Great Food!!!!!! Planing to go back. Roy Wassner 916-410-2715

I give 4 stars because out of the many times I been here I only had a few issues but enough to write about when I go here its almost like I get better service when its there's more customers and slower the less I donno how its odd so I hardly order take out from anywhere well a few weeks ago maybe a month ago I ordered take out and very very disappointed in the food I ordered the 2 for $20 I got fries pickles as the app and we got 2 orders of the honey chipotle  crispers we asked for ranch also when I got home I notice they crispers did not have the sause  on them but on the side to where we had to get another bowl out so toss them ourselves and the ranch was in side the boxes with the hot food the ranch was not OK to eat as it was really hot the pickles were nasty and I pretty much just ate 1 crisper and a few fried because everything was ruined wasted my money and time
The food and service is never consistent. One time food seems good and service so so. Very difficult to find perfect pairing between both.
Service was great....the food...so so, but when you ask for more sour cream, they charge you 80 cents an ounce without telling you before hand.  We will never go back to this place or any chili's.

After a long days work and stressed, there isn't anything better than going to Chilis to unwind. Having a watermelon margarita just takes you to a happy place added with excellent customer service and good humor you could ask for anything more! Good job team members

My husband and I come to this chills all of the time. Tonight we walked in and unlike normal, there was no hostess at the host table. We waited for about 5 minutes while no one greeted us or acknowledged our presence. There was plenty of open tables and they were obviously not busy. The hostess FINALLY came out and told us we had to wait 5 mins for a table or that we could sit in the bar and directed us towards a booth. We walked back o the booth and it had food scraps all over it. My husband and I walked out. I have been a faithful customer of this chills and have never had this experience before but this experience has lead me to take my business elsewhere.

5 stars for our server and food. 1 star for hosting... Uh, hello? Where is the host. I stood there with my boyfriend and one other person for about 3 minutes before she finally showed up. The other person didn't feel like waiting because they walked out. We should've followed suit. After we were seated I witnessed three other couples walk out because they weren't being helped. Isn't the hostess' job to stay at the front counter and greet customers? Not stand in the back kitchen with everyone else. Hmm. I would understand the wait if it was busy, but it wasn't. Someone must have told her to stay up there because she was staying at post the rest of the time I was there. Unfortunately, that didn't help the situation because as people were leaving she didn't say thank you or have a good night or anything. Didn't even see her smile once. That's TERRIBLE customer service. Losing three groups because of a no where to be found hostess. If you don't want to work then quit.   My food was great. Server was awesome. He was super nice and apologized for his delay. He was faster than the host..  Hopefully the next time we decide to come back we won't be waiting at the door to be seated.
Food was good and decent. Took a bit to get our orders in. Table digital menu is a nice touch. Not too busy on a weeknight.

FOOD POISONING.....Went to this chili's monday night sat at the bar ordered a regular cheeseburger. They brought it out and I ate it and thought," that's a lot of mustard on this burger." I even told the bartender he even discounted the meal. So here I sit with FOOD POISONING can't stop throwing up. Don't ever eat here. They dropped the burger on the ground or it was old, something happened where they felt they had to cover up the taste with Hella mustard and now I'm sick. Thanks chilli's.

Stood in line while 3 who came in after us were seated before us. Apparently not being obnoxious doesn't get you served here. A little miffed i have to leave a star at all. Took our quiet patience and tips around the corner to Mountain Mikes. MUCH better service!!

The host Jamie was amazing. She kept us entertained at the door while we waited for our booth. It was my moms birthday and she got a booth for us that would accommodate all of our family. Expected wait time was fifteen minutes but we got in right away! Thank you Jamie for everything. We want her as our server next time.
I come here about two/three times a week because I love it. One of my favorite places to go eat. The food is good and it always arrives quickly.

it was busy lumh time...but more than half the tables were open or uncleared and tons of groups were waiting to be seated. order was taken right away yet took almost 30 minutws for appetizer to come out and an additional 30 minutes after that for the fppd to arrive....should not take 2 hours from walking through the door to paying the check!

Just had an excellent customer service experience with this location.  V-Day can be a crazy one with the amount of people out, so we called ahead to make sure we didn't have to wait too long. When we got there, there was no record of this however, but they assured us we would be seated soon (mind you it was a 30min+ wait time).  Expecting to wait the normal time, we went outside to wait in the car. Not 5mins later, a text comes in saying our table is ready! As they seat us, they apologize again for the issue with the call ahead. After that, we also had a great server named Eric. He has a great personality to match his serving abilities. No problems with the food, we got the extras we asked for, etc. He also wasn't on autopilot mode as some servers are, he was very personable toward out table which it greatly appreciated. Finally, we got the manager over to commend the workers of that night. He was a fantastic manager, and took the compliments well, and made sure to tell us he would tell the crew about our comments. Thanks Chili's staff of Feb 14, 2016!

Came here tonight with a bit of hesitancy.  Anyone would with a chain resturaunt.  However I was astounded by how gracious,  polite, and diligent the staff were. Nichole the bartender was on point and frequently checked in on me. Great bar. Happy hour all day sunday.  Food was awesome.  Get a mid rare steak, a beer, and enjoy your evening.  Don't forget to tip.

Very disappointed.         My first issue arose when my mother opened her napkin to find a fork with rice stuck in the prongs, she asked the waiter for a new one he took it and informed her there was two forks in the napkin and left, she never received a replacement fork.         The next issue was when we finally received our burgers the meat patties were very very dry, the lettuce and onion were inside the burgers even though we requested them to be removed and the sauce (normally on the burger) was served to us on the side as he had entered the entire order incorrectly into the computer (he had informed).            The only thing enjoyable about this meal was our aps on fried asparagus we all wish we had just done aps for dinner rather than digest those disgusting burgers.

The wait is never very long and the experience is basically what you'd expect from a chain. The server was friendly and attentive, food was good and came out in good time. It's nothing to write home about but we'll be back when we're in the mood for a decently priced appetizer,  burger and beer.

My review is based on multiple visits to this Chili's, not just one occasion. There have been times when the service was slow, but overall the service is great and quick. I typically go during my lunch hour at work and can get there, order, eat and return to work within that hour. The food is fantastic. I do have a few favorites (chicken and carnitas fajitas, loaded baked potato soup, skillet mashed potatoes, to name a few) and I have never been disappointed. It's very filing so dessert isn't ordered, but I keep swearing I'll go there just for that cookie with ice cream thing. One of these days. By the way, Ken you are AWESOME! (my favorite server). I will definitely return to this Chili's over and over again.

My fiancé and I had the absolute worst service at this location! First the waiter had forgotten to take our order, then literally an HOUR later , our food still hadn't come. When we brought it to the waiters attention he went to the back and got our food, and of course it was completely the wrong order. By that time my fiancé was pissed, and still kindly asked the waiter to pack the food to go, because by this time we were there for an hour and a half and still hadn't ate. I never had such a bad experience, I was pretty shocked.

Eaten here a  couple of times never had a problem with anything. The only suggestion I have is try to avoid sitting in back where their take out area is. The employees tend to gather here and can hear all the gossip. To me it doesnt bug me that much but I know a lot of people are super picky about where they sit.

wow management is horrible.  no host/hostess, nobody helping us for refills.  i only see one waitress in the entire restaurant.  at least 15 people have literally walked in waited for 10 minutes with no acknowledgement from anyone that works here then walk out.  My buddy and I are laughing as we tell them that no one works here.   I've been to many Chilis restaurants and this is the worst one ever.  I'm new to the area and I'm never coming back here.

Went for lunch yesterday, first off the music was so loud you could barely carry on a conversation. Ordered the turkey club. Disappointed that the turkey was processed lunch meat, no flavor at all except the taste of shaved inexpensive deli meat.

I've only been here once but overall the experience was positive. I was seated immediately, waitress was polite and attentive, and food was pretty good. I do wish they had sweet potato fries though. I felt bad for our waitress because at the table in front of ours the lady was yelling at her because her medium-rare steak she ordered was to bloody and even though the customer was being very rude and unreasonable the waitress stayed polite the whole time and took care of the steak for her.
Server was good so not on her but theymessed up cooking my order 3 times and it was very chewy I didn't even want to eat it. Manager came over but didn't apologize. I don't think we will return :(

Horrible Horrible dining experience. Oh how i wish i could give a negative star rating!!!! I ordered the mix n match chicken and steak fajitas...the chicken was ok but the steak was so tough and chewy. The floor under the booths was filthy and i sat there and watched one of the waitresses wipe the table and wipe all the food from the table onto the booth seat and the floor. And the icing on the cake was the dead fly in the window next to my husband. We will not visit this establishment ever again.

I took the wife and kid to this place and waited to be seated.  Meanwhile, they were seating other people who had just walked in.  I don't know if it's a racist thing or not, I didn't stick around to debate it.  I took my hundred bucks, plus tip, to another restaurant and vow never to return to Chili's. \

This location must be the butthole of Chili's. I was told there's a 10-15 minute wait when I clearly saw open tables scattered throughout the place. That should have been the first sign to go elsewhere, but my kid had her heart set on Chili's that evening. So we waited and after being seated, waited 10 minutes for a server to get our drink order and his section wasn't even full. The hardest part was continuously asking him to repeat himself due to his heavy accent. My entree was terrible, overcooked penne, thin runny over salted sauce and the most pathetic excuse for Cajun seasoning ever. I moved the dish to the edge of the table after 1 bite and there it sat for nearly 15 minutes before another server noticed it and asked if there was an issue. Our original server did ask if our meals were okay, but only maybe 1 minute after we received them and I hadn't even tried it yet as I was still working on my salad. I told him I hadn't tried it yet so he said he'd be back but never returned. My meal was comped which was expected because I wasn't going to pay for that dish of garbage. I even had to walk up to the bar and get another beer for myself because our server must have had more important issues going on in he back of house rather than refilling drinks, checking on food and customers.  This location was a hot spot years ago, now it must be ran by idiotic monkeys. I might return to this location but only if it's on fire and I'm the one rushing in to save people from burning to death in such a shitty place!

Definitely the most A-ok review I can give. We went in the early afternoon for light snacks. Ended up sharing a large appetizer. Service was friendly and food arrived fast. The taste was about as average as it got, but we were ok with that. The sliders were great. Kind of plain as I tend to make my own homemade sliders and load them up. But everything was just ok. If you're someone who is a good cook at home, you may not be very impressed. But as a quick stop somewhere for a light appetizer and fair prices, Chilis is just fine.

Came here tonight and literally had one of the worst dining experiences of my life. 4 parties were seated before us, WHO CAME IN AFTER US.... turkey burger was served partially raw as well. Server apologized re made it again. 2nd turkey burger was again raw and luke warm to the touch. I had to ask twice to have it removed from the bill and manager never came to the table. Not to mention the salad that we had with out meals was brown. I will make sure to avoid this place in the future.

Went here on a Thursday night, no wait, service was great our waiter did an excellent job at making sure our table was taken care of. I recommend the Cajun chicken pasta and their blueberry margaritas were delicious. I wish I could remember our waiters name so I could give him credit where credit is deserved, A++ service thank you for making our Friday eve a good one!

We had the worst experience at Chili's! I had the new Ultimate bacon burger & it tasted awful!!! I don't know what kind of meat it was made from but it sure didn't taste like ground beef grain fed  The meat stunk, the bun was stale and the fries tasted like they were freezer burnt!! We waited for a hour to get our food  & when it finally got to our table it was just horrible!!! We will never go there again; I felt sorry for the waitress she was working her butt off Definitely not ever going back to this chili's again

Disappointed,  came in with my toddler waiting approximately 15 minutes to be asked how many in my party. I answered and the host says, your welcome to sit in the bar. I stated that wasn't appropriate.  He quipped it'll be about 10 minutes then. I asked another 10? His response was i don't know what is happening in was on my break. Service was slow the host clearly setting the tone.

Why can't a restaurant present food like it is on the menu or better yet give you what you ordered. After driving round trip 40 minutes I get my food out of the Togo bag only to find the waitress dumped everything because she can't put food in a bag, and she forgot my salad .. thanks for ruining my dinner .. * I see chilis reached out to me..you have burned me too many times chilis . Bye bye
We love this place ! Good food, good service. Good seletion of my beers ! My wife and I had our first date here. Six years later were still madly in love ! And we are still coming back.

What happened to this place? I remember it being delicious years ago. Did they get new owners? Did they get bought out by Comcast? I ordered some traditional ribs that looked like they fell behind the make line in the kitchen. I expected my rack of ribs to be somewhat crispy with BBQ sauce but all I got was a soggy rack that got microwaved too long covered in a disgusting sour ketchup sauce. I guess this place isn't that bad if all you're used to eating is microwaved dinners.

Very good service. I had a gift card for Chilis so my boyfriend and I decided to eat here for lunch after our visit with my Grandma. I ate the Ultimate Bacon Cheesburger meal and he had the Margarita salad. Everything was very good. The only minor issue is that the side of avocado was not delivered with his salad, but it was resolved in a very prompt manner.  Their beer prices are reasonable too. I got a huge glass of Sidecar for $6.45 which is more budget friendly than some of the other places that serve hand crafted beers. Was my first time here, I guess this place has been in Citrus Heights for awhile, and yet I ate here for the first time,., but will come back here when I am in the area.

I came here yesterday with a friend. I got a bacon cheeseburger + avacado, and she got some kind of turkey bacon sandwich on SUPER THICK bread. My burger was fine ( cooked medium like I asked ). Her turkey was so cold, it was almost frozen, and the bread was as thick as Texas Toast, but wheat. Service was decent, but they let the dirty cups and dishes pile up on the table, and I didnt like that at all.

here on a Wednesday night seated immediately. Went down hill from there, not to long before waiter came just for drinks, 10 minutes later came to get order and we didn't see him for another 20 minutes and very quickly at that. When the food came we had to grab someone twice for napkins then they were pretty much thrown at us. Waiter never came back to see how food was or if we needed anything. When we finished we waited another 17 min before I got up and asked for the manager, told him the problem and he just didn't seem to think it was a big deal. Mgr came back with the bill but didn't even offer a discount, started to walk away and I asked about desert with the meal. Just a bad experience all around. Food was good but I don't know if I would waste my time there again. Especially when there were several waiters walking all around and none stopped and mgr didn't care.

Poor service.  No water or silverware or final ticket in a timely manner. Had 3 different waiters and waitress.  Menu was deceptive and was charged more than what menu seemed to say.  My son touched the kiosk on the table and was charged 2 dollars without being notified of the charge.  Try Olive Garden or Golden Corral.

My family has been to this Chili's many times. Tonight my mil invited us out for dinner. We arrived around 6:40 pm. It was pretty busy, so we had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated. Not bad. Maybe they were a little understaffed tonight because receiving our food took longer than expected. Our server was very kind and repeatedly apologized for that. The manager also came out and apologized. He also gave us free chips and dip which was nice of him. Our food was just fine, no skimping. Everyone enjoyed what they ordered. We received a discount because of the wait, which we appreciated. We left a big tip because our server did his best and kept us as happy as he could.
Hate that they got ride of blue bowls that kept fajitas warm. Wrapping in tin foil makes the tortilla stick together. Will not be back until they change back.
The service was horrible, the past three times I've went there. I will be eating at a different location from now on.

The absolute worst Chili's I've ever been to after waiting 5 to 8 minutes for the hosts to even come up to the podium and no one else even greeted us, we are informed  that the wait for the kitchen would be 30 minutes or more once we were seated on top of that when we asked if they did have any chicken enchilada soup to go the host looked with a dumbfounded expression and claims he didn't even know what that is, at that point we just walked out and will not go back to Chili's. Absolutely diculous a restaurant like this can manage to stay open
Been on a chill's kick and this location is so much better than Roseville. Worth the drive away from home for it.

This Chili's is so convenient, one block from our house! But we stopped getting their to go food because there was always something wrong--steak was cooked well done and dry, fries tasted old, food was barely lukewarm. We decided to try them again since I received a gift card for Christmas. Chili's. Seriously. Get it together. Is it so difficult to cook a steak correctly? We asked for it medium rare, and it came out practically raw. I do like their fajitas, but it's hard to enjoy lukewarm food. We won't be going back.
I was quickly seated. It was very loud in there. At times it was difficult to speak to the person with me. My food was quite good. Christian, my server, was AWESOME.

Here at chili's eating. Came out for $5 margarita night on Thursday's. Sat down order a margarita, most servers would know to ask the special or regular but no. Actually we had to ask three servers to get the answer. Food was cold, had to ask for straws, and waited over 10 minutes for our drinks. Last drink we ordered was supposed to be strawberry but when it came out no strawberry. Not a good visit will not come back to this location

Went to chillis tonight even though I normally don't. My kids and I were seated and waited for 7 minutes without anyone even saying hi. We watched as two more families were seated after we were and they were promptly helped. After 7 minutes we decided to leave and when we stood up our waiter appeared and didn't bother to say a single word to us as we walked out. Service was horrible, glad I didn't stick around to be likely disappointed by the food too.
Chilis is Chilis. Good days and bad days but I really do enjoy being able to walk in, get seated quickly, service not always quick but overall just a good quick fix for a restaurant outing.

Came to eat here several times. They have a $10 special going on that includes an entree, appetizers,  and dessert. Well worth it. I've had their fajitas and ribs with salad, but you can also pick macaroni and cheese, soup , fries, among other choices for your appetizers too.  Then their lava cake for dessert!  if you don't want the lava cake, you can pay just an extra $2 for their other choice of desserts. One did, and chose their berry cobbler with a large scoop of ice cream. Was so good! Will come here again to try  other menu items, as they have an extensive menu. Have tv's to watch sport games throughout the restaurant too.

Horrible service. They never make my order right, and I always give them chances since my best friend loves this place. Been seated for 20 min now, we just got our order taken 10 minutes ago, and got our waters just now. If I could give less than 1 star I would

This time part of our groups orders were extremely late ... 3 of us were done eating by the time they got theirs  Had to ask for everything we needed when normally you'd already have chips, napkins, etc.. I'm not sure what's going on at this location, but I don't think it's going to change.

The Fair Oaks Chili's is consistently going downhill.  Either they have no manager or the manager is asleep in the office.  It's always dirty and the service is terrible, but it's not the servers fault.....they have to many tables to serve and can't keep up. To many mistakes on orders and to long of a wait for food.  It's to bad because we always thought their burgers and fries were the best, but it's just not worth the frustration.  Hopefully, a new Manager is on the horizon.
Great service, great food, awesome drinks, in and out quickly. Great place to take the fam!

Not waiter's fault but will never order steak again. We order 2 steaks. Bith to be pink centers. Got fresh blood which ran into sides all over plate. Returned to kitchen came back still bleeding. Send back and now can't chew. Instead of starting over the 2nd time with fresh meat they broiled to half its size and said that's what happens...dog will eat it tonight.

Came here for lunch and had the margarita chicken and chips and salsa. It wasn't busy during this time and we got our food not long after ordering. The margarita chicken and chips and salsa was just as good as any other chilis I've had. I'll be coming here again since it's so close and was good. I haven't had other dishes from this location yet though. The service was good and not slow either.

First time at this location and probably first time at Chili's , I don't remember ever eating at Chili's so me and my wife decided to stop by and we ordered some ribs and some grilled chicken and the food was actually pretty good the place is a little dated but that's all right and would be nice if customer service was a little better, I had to get up and get my own napkins and never got the extra plate I asked for and took a while to get a straw for my drink.
This was my first time at this restaurant and I got to say it was wonderful I cant complain the food was good employees were great and polite

I've lived in the area for a long time and for one reason or another this Chili's was never visited.  I wish it had stayed that way.  I walk in, it's Sunday around 5, so I get it that they might of been busy.  The group in front of me is acknowledged and seated. I then stand there for what felt like an awkwardly long time. Servers walk by and don't acknowledge me. The host finally returns. Half heartedly apologized and offered the bar. When I declined he made a face.  He sat me down and told me my server was "great and wonderful".  About 8 minutes go by without anyone even pretending to care.  Eventually the server comes over, and she couldn't care less. Acted so disinterested and offered nothing. Took my order and dipped.  It was when she slammed my soda down and kept walking that I knew I didn't want to give this place my money.  I walked out.  Never coming back.  All in all.  This place sucks.

Service was prompt. Waiter was friendly but not overly so. Shrimp was cooked well in my entree. The new "Queso with Spinach dip" was just sad, Tasted of watery cheese with a thick layer of hardened cheese on top that you could hardly get through. There was about 3 pieces of spinach in there only. Their old spinach dip was our main drive to go there. Seems they changed things.

Completely grossed out.  Came here for lunch at 3:30pm.  Smelled like the restroom.  The floors are dirty, my menu had ketchup and food stuck to it.  Our waitress smelled of cigarettes and empowering overload fruit spray.  Salad was wilted.  Fajita bell peppers were not fresh.  The guacamole was dark brown.  The fajita streak was rubbery and over cooked.  Come to find out they cook fajitas in the oven.... here's a translation of Fajita from the web: "Fajita. A fajita (/fhit/; Spanish: [faxita] ( listen)) is a term found in Tex-Mex cuisine, commonly referring to any grilled meat usually served as a taco on a flour or corn tortilla. ".... any grilled meat.  Won't be back.

We love Chilis but not this one. I am a very plain eater. So I ordered, I would love a plain cheeseburger ketchup only. The waitress read back my order, ok so you want a cheeseburger with no bun?  I paused as if she was serious. When I realized she was, I repeated my order. No I would like a plain cheeseburger. So cheese, meat and a bun. She then repeated back my order, ok so you want a cheeseburger with everything and no bun?  I finally said mam, are you being serious? She didnt like that I asked that however what else was I supposed to do? Finally the food came out, a burger with everything and no bun. So I laughed and told the guy who brought our food it was wrong. He said omg shes the worst! He literally admitted she gets everyones orders wrong all the time. He was hilarious and brought me what I wanted asap.  Best part was the waitress came over and proceeded to tell me with so much attitude, I ordered what was brought out. We got in an argument and she ended up storming off. I am 90% sure she was on something. This chilis is so bad. We will drive to a farther one to avoid the idiots who were hired at this one.
Always friendly & prompt service. Our server today was particularly nice & even remembered having served us on a prior visit.

I really like Chili's but this one was a bit on the dirty side. The menus were sticky and the table game system thing was really gross and could have used a good wipe down!! The food was very good! We enjoyed the chips and salsa to start. The chips were so fresh and light.  The chipotle chicken & waffle dish with  the street grilled corn on the Cobb was so good!! The fries were seasoned perfectly and hot!!
Food is airways great here. Service awesome. Very friendly staff. Chicken and waffles are fantastic!

Just 2 of us and we were seated by a table of 17. Never got acknowledged or asked if we'd like a drink. The waiter had his hands full and we should never have been seated there. As we left the "greeter" said oh sorry. Went down the road to our favorite Mexican place.

I dislike Chillis so much that I measure the experience to going to Carl's Jr, don't expect full service. Went to the Folsom location for a special Family night and was treated horribly. Server never came back to the table after taking our food order, so didn't get a refill on our drinks until the food came. Server nor manager came up to the table One single time before the food was brought out. After the food was brought out and refills were given (after asking for them) she still never came back to check on us. (How's the food, need anything, etc..?) Nothing. To top it off the server ONLY had 3 tables!!!!!!! If you aren't expecting much Go to Chillis. For a real Family/Date night don't go chillis, for it will ruin your evening!!!!!!

I love Chili's  amd their coupons I love some of their salad it is one of my favorite places to go  Chili's is  amazing however when you sit in the bar I don't think the bartender should be your waiter or waitress because you don't get any service there making drinks and you have to sit and wait until they are available
Had a great meal tonight.  The new asparagus and tomato side is wonderful.   Definitely need to try it if you haven't.

My fiancé and I normally come here as one of our spots when we don't feel like cooking, as I am sure everyone can relate. Most of the time we go to the restaurant, sometimes to go.  Today was one of the times we took it to go.  My fiancé ordered the Quesadilla explosion salad. I believe one of the key components to a salad is the dressing. Somehow, the dressing was missing. Didn't realize it until took everything out of the bag at home. I ordered the Smokehouse combo. I have been ordering this the last several times, as it generally has all the good stuff. But it seems like at least the last several times, they forget about the pickles.  I don't expect places like this to be 5 michelin stars, but I would at least hope that the majority of the time, they remember all the components to the dish. I mean seriously, how do you forget dressing on a salad.  I guess this is one of the places when I go to only when I am having a craving for this restaurant, which is higher on the tier than when I am feeling lazy and just don't want to cook. The only reason why I am giving two stars instead of two is because the food doesn't has a spoiled taste, the service when we eat at the restaurant is generally pretty good.

I usually don't visit chain restaurants but i always look forward to visiting here to watch football on Sundays.  The service is fantastic especially with how busy they get and you'll find yourself tipping a little extra.  Great specials for drinks and appetizers all day Sunday.

Being an avid chili's-goer I have a lot of experience with the service at chili's, I was greatly disappointed. The hostess was not very attentive and looked angry the entire time and took awhile after our quoted wait time to be seated. When they brought out our drinks they just left them at the end of the table without saying a word. We saw the server twice the entire time. Just a little disappointed.

Just ate here. Food was super good. I had the Texas size ribs and they were amazing!! Sara was our server and she did awesome!!!! She was really busy (someone called out) she communicated that to us and she made sure our drinks were always full and that we enjoyed our time at Chili's. We will be back!! Good job girl
